{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1915 |Team=Washington State Cougars |Image= |ImageSize=120x119 |Conference= Independent |ShortConference= |Division= |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=7-0 |ConfRecord= |HeadCoach=[[William Henry Dietz]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena= [[Rogers Field (Washington State)|Rogers Field]] |Champion=Rose Bowl champions |BowlTourney=[[Rose Bowl (game)|Rose Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult=Win, 14-0, vs. [[Brown University]] }} The '''1915 Washington State Cougars football team''' represented [[Washington State University]] during the 1915 NCAA college football season. The Cougars offense scored 204 points while the defense allowed 10 points. Led by head coach William Dietz, the Cougars competed in and won the Rose Bowl.
